verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> to the bloody <WH1818> city! <WH5892> It is all full <WH4392> of lies <WH3585> and robbery. <WH6563> The prey <WH2964> doesn't <WH4185> depart.
The noise <WH6963> of the whip, <WH7752> the noise <WH6963> of the rattling <WH7494> of wheels, <WH212> prancing <WH1725> horses, <WH5483> and bounding <WH7540> chariots, <WH4818>

the horseman <WH6571> mounting, <WH5927> and the flashing <WH1300> sword, <WH2719> the glittering <WH1300> spear, <WH2595> and a multitude <WH7230> of slain, <WH2491> and a great <WH3514> heap of corpses, <WH6297> and there is no end <WH7097> of the bodies. <WH6297> They stumble <WH3782> on their bodies, <WH1472>

because of the multitude <WH7230> of the prostitution <WH2183> of the alluring <WH2896> prostitute, <WH2181> the mistress <WH1172> of witchcraft, <WH3785> who sells <WH4376> nations <WH1471> through her prostitution, <WH2183> and families <WH4940> through her witchcraft. <WH3785>

"Behold, <WH5002> I am against you," says Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies, <WH6635> "and I will lift <WH1540> your skirts <WH7757> over your face. <WH6440> I will show <WH7200> the nations <WH1471> your nakedness, <WH4626> and the kingdoms <WH4467> your shame. <WH7036>
I will throw <WH7993> abominable filth <WH8251> on you, <WH5034> and make you vile, and will set <WH7760> you a spectacle. <WH7210>

It will happen that all those who look <WH7200> at you will flee <WH5074> from you, <WH559> and say, <WH5210> 'Nineveh is laid waste! <WH7703> Who will mourn <WH5110> for her? <WH370>' Where will I seek <WH1245> comforters for you? <WH5162>"

Are you better <WH3190> than No <WH4996> - Amon, <WH527> who was situated <WH3427> among the rivers, <WH2975> who had the waters <WH4325> around <WH5439> her; <WH2426> whose rampart was the sea, <WH3220> and her wall <WH2346> was of the sea? <WH3220>
Cush <WH3568> and Egypt <WH4714> were her boundless <WH369> strength. <WH6109> Put <WH6316> and Libya <WH3864> were her helpers. <WH5833>

Yet was she carried away. <WH1473> She went <WH1980> into captivity. <WH7628> Her young children <WH5768> also were dashed in pieces <WH7376> at the head <WH7218> of all the streets, <WH2351> and they cast <WH3032> lots <WH1486> for her honorable men, <WH3513> and all her great men <WH1419> were bound <WH7576> in chains. <WH2131>
You also will be drunken. <WH7937> You will be hidden. <WH5956> You also will seek <WH1245> a stronghold <WH4581> because of the enemy. <WH341>
All your fortresses <WH4013> will be like fig trees <WH8384> with the first-ripe <WH1061> figs: if they are shaken, <WH5128> they fall <WH5307> into the mouth <WH6310> of the eater. <WH398>

Behold, <WH5971> your troops in your midst <WH7130> are women. <WH802> The gates <WH8179> of your land <WH776> are set wide <WH6605> open <WH6605> to your enemies. <WH341> The fire <WH784> has devoured <WH398> your bars. <WH1280>

Draw <WH7579> water <WH4325> for the siege. <WH4692> Strengthen <WH2388> your fortresses. <WH4013> Go <WH935> into the clay, <WH2916> and tread <WH7429> the mortar. <WH2563> Make the brick kiln <WH4404> strong. <WH2388>

There the fire <WH784> will devour <WH398> you. <WH2719> The sword will cut you off. <WH3772> It will devour <WH398> you like the grasshopper. <WH3218> Multiply <WH3513> like grasshoppers. <WH3218> Multiply <WH3513> like the locust. <WH697>
You have increased <WH7235> your merchants <WH7402> more than the stars <WH3556> of the skies. <WH8064> The grasshopper <WH3218> strips, <WH6584> and flees away. <WH5774>

Your guards <WH4502> are like the locusts, <WH697> and your officials <WH2951> like the swarms of locusts, <WH1462> which settle <WH2583> on the walls <WH1448> on a cold <WH7135> day, <WH3117> but when the sun <WH8121> appears, <WH2224> they flee away, <WH5074> and their place <WH4725> is not known <WH3045> where they are. <WH335>

Your shepherds <WH7462> slumber, <WH5123> king <WH4428> of Assyria. <WH804> Your nobles <WH117> lie <WH7931> down. <WH5971> Your people are scattered <WH6335> on the mountains, <WH2022> and there is no one to gather them. <WH6908>

There is no healing <WH3545> your wound, <WH7667> for your injury <WH4347> is fatal. <WH2470> All who hear <WH8085> the report <WH8088> of you clap <WH8628> their hands <WH3709> over you; <WH5674> for who hasn't felt your endless <WH8548> cruelty? <WH7451>
